title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.22 | 08-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurun Meelitam Yena Dasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Paschatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 22nd verse of the 10th chapter
of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
This is a continuation of the talk of the ladies of Hastinapura about Krishna.
Sa eva bhuyo nija virya choditam
Sorry
Sa eva bhuyo nija virya choditam
Svajivamayam prakritim sisrikshatim
Anama roopatmani roopanamani
Viditsamano anusasara shastrakrit
The meaning of this verse is
The personality of Godhead, again desiring to give names and forms to his parts and parcels,
the living entities, place them under the guidance of material nature.
By his own potency, material nature is empowered to recreate.
So in the talk they are describing how this creation takes place by the intervention of
Krishna.
Hmm.
So in the Purport Shila, Prabhupada explains
The living entities are parts and parcels of the Lord.
Each one of us, every living being is a part and parcel.
Part means you can understand, a very very tiny portion of the Lord, supreme whole.
Parcel means inseparable part.
Inseparable part.
We cannot be separated from the Lord completely.
We cannot be separated from the Lord completely.
We cannot be separated from the Lord completely.
The relationship or the link in terms of relationship always exists eternally.
Unlike the relationships in this world, which are based on the body, when the body s annihilated
there is no meaning to the relationship at all.
Whereas, our relationship with Krishna is spirit soul to the supreme spirit.
And send the spirit soul is eternal.
Supreme spirit Krishna is eternal.
If then there is no meaning to the relationship.
